meanings.definition: To remove furniture or furnishings from a space.
meanings.sent1: She disfurnishes the room before painting the walls.
meanings.sent2: The moving company will disfurnish the old house before transporting the belongings.
meanings.sent3: After she disfurnishes the living room, it looks so empty and spacious.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disfurnish the landscape, leaving everything exposed and bare.
meanings.sent5: Disfurnishing the office made it easier to rearrange the layout.

meanings.definition: To deprive of furniture or furnishings.
meanings.sent1: The landlord disfurnishes the apartment after the tenant moves out.
meanings.sent2: The minimalist design disfurnishes the space for a sleek and modern look.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said his cat disfurnishes the room by knocking things over.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter seemed to disfurnish the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: Disfurnishing the bedroom created a serene and calming atmosphere.
